update.description:
This pull request extends the `Factory` class to support the creation of a Protobuf message at runtime based on its message descriptor. The descriptor (`.desc`) can be triggered with the option `--descriptor_set_out=FILE`. We also assume that descriptors are generated with the option `include_imports` that include all dependencies of the input file, so the descriptor is self-contained.

How to test this PR?

* Compile the Ignition Transport examples and run `./publisher_custom_msg`
* Open a new terminal and point `IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR` to `<YOUR_IGN_MSG_REPO>/test/desc`. Here's the descriptor `stringmsg.desc` for the message published by `publisher_custom_msg`.
* Run `ign topic -t /foo -e` and you should be able to introspect the custom message.

Note: I needed some functionality of `Ignition::common::Filesystem` for iterating over a list of files in a given directory. I copied a subset of that class from Ignition Common here. We can remove this code when Ignition Common components are ready. I'm also open to suggestions if you think there's a better way of doing it.

Thanks also to @peter_mitrano , who started working on this feature a while ago.
update.title: Extend Factory class

content.raw: I improved the coverage a bit more.
content.html: I improved the coverage a bit more.

content.raw: do we want to test a `.desc` file from one of our ignition msgs? I'm not sure if that makes sense, but I see some uncovered lines in [Factory::New](https://codecov.io/bb/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/src/dynamic_factory_1/src/Factory.cc#L212) specifically related to the ignition naming.
content.html: do we want to test a .desc file from one of our ignition msgs? I'm not sure if that makes sense, but I see some uncovered lines in Factory::New specifically related to the ignition naming.

content.raw: I think it suppresses a windows warning
content.html: I think it suppresses a windows warning

content.raw: do you know if this macro is needed? I see it in ign-common's FileSystem class too but I'm interested to know when we need to add this macro?
content.html: do you know if this macro is needed? I see it in ign-common's FileSystem class too but I'm interested to know when we need to add this macro?

content.html: This commit should improve the coverage a little bit. 0dd3ba3

update.title: Extend Factory class

content.raw:
Question about loading `IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR`. It seems that `DynamicFactory` will load all the `.desc` files in `IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR` on start. Why also do it here?

I think you could `return` if `descPaths.empty()`, and move the `std::getenv("IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR");` up to the constructor.
content.html:
Question about loading IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR. It seems that DynamicFactory will load all the .desc files in IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR on start. Why also do it here?

I think you could return if descPaths.empty(), and move the std::getenv("IGN_DESCRIPTOR_DIR"); up to the constructor.

update.description:
This pull request extends the `Factory` class to support the creation of a Protobuf message at runtime based on its message descriptor. The descriptor (`.desc`) can be triggered with the option `--descriptor_set_out=FILE`. We also assume that descriptors are generated with the option `include_imports` that include all dependencies of the input file, so the descriptor is self-contained.

How to test this PR?

* Compile the Ignition Transport examples and run `./publisher_custom_msg`
* Open a new terminal and point `IGN_DESCRIPTOR_PATH` to `<YOUR_IGN_MSG_REPO>/test/desc`. Here's the descriptor `stringmsg.desc` for the message published by `publisher_custom_msg`.
* Run `ign topic -t /foo -e` and you should be able to introspect the custom message.

Note: I needed some functionality of `Ignition::common::Filesystem` for iterating over a list of files in a given directory. I copied a subset of that class from Ignition Common here. We can remove this code when Ignition Common components are ready. I'm also open to suggestions if you think there's a better way of doing it.

Thanks also to @peter_mitrano , who started working on this feature a while ago.
update.title: Extend Factory class

content.raw:
Thanks. I've changed a bit the implementation because this class is hard to test setting an environment variable. The `static` nature of it makes it load before we can set the environment variable from the test. I've exposed a parameter in `Factory` to load descriptors from a directory and this is what I'm using for testing it. I removed the `setenv` because is not needed anymore.

[Windows](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/122/) is happy now. :blue_circle:
content.html:
Thanks. I've changed a bit the implementation because this class is hard to test setting an environment variable. The static nature of it makes it load before we can set the environment variable from the test. I've exposed a parameter in Factory to load descriptors from a directory and this is what I'm using for testing it. I removed the setenv because is not needed anymore.

Windows is happy now.

the windows build was broken
